headerDisplay: This plugin is currently experimental and under development.  Please report [bugs](https://github.com/kovapatrik/homebridge-midea-platform/issues)

refreshInterval.title: Interval, in seconds, to query Midea devices for state
refreshInterval.description: Frequency that the plugin will query devices for their current state (temperature, humidity, etc.). Some Midea devices update the plugin automatically on any change, others require that the device is queried. The default is 30 seconds, the maximum is 86400 (24 hours). Setting value to 0 (zero) disables polling and updates will only be noted if devices sends it automatically.

heartbeatInterval.title: Interval, in seconds, to send keep-alive message to Midea devices
heartbeatInterval.description: Frequency that the plugin sends a message to Midea devices to keep the network socket open. The default and minimum is 10 seconds, you can increase this up to a maximum of 120 (2 minutes). If you see socket closed messages in the log reduce this value.

verbose.title: Enable verbose logging
verbose.description: Enables additional debug logging that may help a developer identify problems when working on Midea device support. Homebridge must be running with debug enabled for any debug logging to be visible.

logRecoverableErrors.title: Log recoverable errors
logRecoverableErrors.description: If you see frequent warning or error messages in the log that the plugin recovers from you can suppress these messages by disabling this setting.

type.title: Device Type
type.description: Select the type of device you are adding.

name.title: Device Name
name.description: This replaces the name provided by the Midea device.

id.title: Device Identifier
id.description: The ID of the device. This shouldn't be changed if it was added by discovery.

token.title: Device login token
token.description: Token of the device obtained from cloud. This shouldn't be changed if it was added by discovery.

key.title: Device login key
key.description: Key of the device obtained from cloud. This shouldn't be changed if it was added by discovery.

verbose.title: Enable verbose logging
verbose.description: Override global setting for this one device.

logRecoverableErrors.title: Log recoverable errors
logRecoverableErrors.description: Override global setting for this one device.

singleAccessory.title: Single Accessory
singleAccessory.description: Toggles if the device and the optional sub accessories (e.g.: outdoor temperature sensor, display switch) are combined into one accessory or not.

swingMode.title: Swing Mode
swingMode.description: Set swing mode of the unit. If you AC does not support this feature then leave it on None.

outDoorTemp.title: Outdoor Temperature
outDoorTemp.description: Toggles if the outdoor temperature is created with the accessory.

audioFeedback.title: Audio Feedback
audioFeedback.description: Toggles if the unit beeps when a command is sent.

ecoSwitch.title: Eco Mode Switch
ecoSwitch.description: Toggles if the ECO mode switch is created with the accessory.

flag.title: Switch Display
flag.description: Toggles if a switch, which can turn the display on or off will be created or not.

command.title: Switch Display Alternate Command
command.description: Use this if the switch display command does not work. If it doesn't work either way then you unit does not support this feature.

fahrenheit.title: Fahrenheit
fahrenheit.description: Toggles if the temperature on the unit is displayed in Fahrenheit or Celsius.

fanOnlyMode.title: Fan Only Mode
fanOnlyMode.description: Toggles if the fan only mode is created with the accessory.
